KA_Analysis.K1: Candidates will define and differentiate various risk analysis methods through written responses, demonstrating their understanding of theoretical underpinnings.
KA_Analysis.A1: Participants will conduct practical risk assessments using provided scenarios, submitting reports detailing identified risks and mitigation strategies.
KA_Analysis.K2: Examinee will describe tell-tale signs and symptoms associated with various security threats and breaches in written format, showcasing their theoretical knowledge.
KA_Analysis.A2: Trainees will analyze simulated scenarios, documenting their observations and applying SOPs to detect and report suspicious activities, evaluated on practical application.
KA_Analysis.K3: Learners will outline organizational security procedures in written answers, reflecting comprehension of theoretical protocols and guidelines.
KA_Analysis.A3: Participants will evaluate complex situations using their experience, documenting their approach and risk assessment findings, judged on practical judgment.
KA_Analysis.K4: The test taker will identify signs related to surveillance, intelligence gathering, and potential threats through written explanations, displaying theoretical awareness.
KA_Analysis.A4: Candidates will engage in group exercises, sharing insights and justifying their risk assessments based on collaborative analysis, graded on practical discussion skills.
KA_Analysis.K5: Examinees will describe terrorist tactics, including suspicious activities and devices, via written responses, assessing theoretical recognition.
KA_Analysis.K6: Trainees will explain the process of identifying persons of interest, outlining key indicators and verification methods in their written responses, confirming understanding of concepts.
